definition: bad/spoiled/broken/to break down/(suffix) to the utmost

to divide/to separate/to distribute/to allocate/to distinguish (good and bad)/part or subdivision/fraction/one tenth (of certain units)/unit of length equivalent to 0.33 cm/minute (unit of time)/minute (angular measurement unit)/a point (in sports or games)/0.01 yuan (unit of money)

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

sentences.english: Akela belongs to a bad element in this city.
sentences.chinese: 阿克拉属于这个城市的坏分子。

sentences.english: We must resolutely clear out all the bad elements in our society.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须坚决清除社会中的坏分子。

sentences.english: He belongs to a bad element in this city.
sentences.chinese: 他属于这个都市的坏分子。

sentences.english: I had my first experience of giving physical torture to a bad element.
sentences.chinese: 我第一次经历了惩罚坏分子的活动。

sentences.english: Sometimes they were subversive enemies of the Roman order.
sentences.chinese: 有时候是罗马命令的破坏分子。

sentences.english: So I kicked the bad element and blood came out of his mouth.
sentences.chinese: 于是我就踢了这个坏分子一脚，他嘴里流出血来。

definition: capitalist roader (person in power taking the capitalist road, a political label often pinned on cadres by the Red Guards during the Cultural Revolution)
evil elements who have escaped eradication
to seize and subject to public criticism (form of persecution during the Cultural Revolution)
stinking intellectual (contemptuous term for educated people during the Cultural Revolution)
local bosses, shady gentry (idiom); dominant local mafia
to drag sb before a public meeting to denounce, humiliate and physically abuse them (esp. during the Cultural Revolution)
